org.divxdede.swing
Class BoundedRangeModelHub

java.lang.Object
  org.divxdede.swing.BoundedRangeModelHub
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<BoundedRangeModel>, EventListener, ChangeListener, org.divxdede.commons.Disposable, org.divxdede.commons.Sizable
public class BoundedRangeModelHub
extends Object
implements ChangeListener, Iterable<BoundedRangeModel>, org.divxdede.commons.Sizable, org.divxdede.commons.Disposable

A BoundedRangeModelHub can split a BoundedRangeModel (call master model in sub-models.

Each sub-models represent a progression part of the master model.
Each sub-models have a weight that describe how combine theses sub-models for computing the master's value.

Two sub-models with the same weight represent the same range progression inside the master model.
A sub-model which has a double weight than another sub-model represent a double range progression inside the master model.
This weighting must be a positive weight and just serve to compute a factor for each sub-models regarding theses weight.

Exemple: BoundedRangeModelHub hub = new BoundedRangeModelHub(); BoundedRangeModel taskA = hub.createFragment(40); // will represent 20% of the master model BoundedRangeModel taskB = hub.createFragment(160); // will represent 80% of the master model hub.setMasterBoundedRangeModel(monModelePrincipal); taskA.setMaximum(1000); for(int i = 0 ; i < 1000 ; i++ ) { taskA.setValue(i); // taskA job } // At this time, the master model is at 20% because taskA is completed taskB.setMaximum(10); for(int i = 0 ; i < 10 ; i++ ) { taskB.setValue(i); // taskB job } // At this time, the master model is at 100% becase taskA and taskB are completed // dispose hub resources (listener and so one) hub.dispose();

Some statics methods allow to split in a one call a model in sub-model:

  • split(BoundedRangeModel, int) an uniform split (each sub-models have the same weight)
  • split(BoundedRangeModel, float...) a non uniform split (each weight are specified by this method)

Since:
1.1
Author:
André Sébastien - INFASS Systèmes (http://www.infass.com)

Constructor Detail

BoundedRangeModelHub

public BoundedRangeModelHub()
Create an empty BoundedRangeModelHub without master model.

The master model must be set with the setMasterBoundedRangeModel(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel) method.
Sub-models must be created or added with createFragment(float) or addFragment(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel, float) methods.

See Also:
setMasterBoundedRangeModel(BoundedRangeModel), createFragment(float)

BoundedRangeModelHub

public BoundedRangeModelHub(BoundedRangeModel master)
Create an empty BoundedRangeModelHub with the specified master model.

Sub-models must be created or added with createFragment(float) or addFragment(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel, float) methods.

See Also:
setMasterBoundedRangeModel(BoundedRangeModel), createFragment(float)
Method Detail

setMasterBoundedRangeModel

public void setMasterBoundedRangeModel(BoundedRangeModel model)
Define the master model to compute from changes mades on sub-models. Any changes that applies from sub-models are forwarded to the master model and the hub re-compute it's value.

Each sub-models can be created or added by createFragment(float) or addFragment(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel, float) methods.
Each sub-models have a weight that describe how combine theses sub-models for computing the master's value.

Two sub-models with the same weight represent the same range progression inside the master model.
A sub-model which has a double weight than another sub-model represent a double range progression inside the master model.
This weighting must be a positive weight and just serve to compute a factor for each sub-models regarding theses weight.

Parameters:
model - New master model to bound to this hub. (can be null)
See Also:
createFragment(float)

getMasterBoundedRangeModel

public BoundedRangeModel getMasterBoundedRangeModel()
Retrieve the master model managed by this hub.
Any changes that applies from sub-models are forwarded to this model and this hub update it's value.

Returns:
Master model managed by this hub (may be null)
See Also:
createFragment(float)

createFragment

public BoundedRangeModel createFragment(float weight)
Create a sub-model with a specified weight.
Any changes that applies from this created sub-model are forwarded to the master model for update it's value.

The new sub-model has a weight that describe how much this fragment take part on the master model.
Two sub-models with the same weight represent the same range progression inside the master model.
A sub-model which has a double weight than another sub-model represent a double range progression inside the master model.
This weighting must be a positive weight and just serve to compute a factor for each sub-models regarding theses weight.

Parameters:
weight - Weight to bound to the newly created sub-model (fragment)
Returns:
The newly created sub-model.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if weight is negative.

addFragment

public BoundedRangeModel addFragment(BoundedRangeModel fragment,
                                     float weight)
Add a BoundedRangeModel as a sub-model with a specified weight.
Any changes that applies from this added sub-model are forwarded to the master model for update it's value.

The added sub-model has a weight that describe how much this fragment take part on the master model.
Two sub-models with the same weight represent the same range progression inside the master model.
A sub-model which has a double weight than another sub-model represent a double range progression inside the master model.
This weighting has no particular constraint, it juste help to compute a factor for each sub-models regarding theses weight.

Parameters:
fragment - Sub-model to add to this hub
weight - Weight to bound to the newly created sub-model (fragment)
Returns:
Return the added sub-model.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if fragment is null
IllegalArgumentException - if weight is negative.

removeFragment

public BoundedRangeModel removeFragment(int index)
Remove a sub-model specified by it's index ordinal from this hub.
Indexes are defined by the creation/insertion order. You can use indexOf(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel) for retrieve an index's sub-model.

Parameters:
index - Index of the sub-model to remove from this hub
Returns:
The removed sub-model, null if no sub-model was removed.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is out of bound.

getFragments

public BoundedRangeModel[] getFragments()
Retrieve all sub-models in this hub.
The result array order ensure that sub-models's index on the array are the same that sub-models's index on this hub.

Returns:
Each sub-models managed by this hub for update the master model.

iterator

public Iterator<BoundedRangeModel> iterator()
Create an iterator over sub-models managed by this hub.
The iteration order ensure that sub-models's index on the array are the same that sub-models's index on this hub.

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<BoundedRangeModel>
Returns:
Iterator from all sub-models managed by this hub for update the master model.

size

public int size()
Return the number of sub-models in this hub.

Specified by:
size in interface org.divxdede.commons.Sizable
Returns:
The number of sub-models in this hub.

indexOf

public int indexOf(BoundedRangeModel model)
Return sub-model's index in this hub for the specified sub-model.
This index can be used with getWeight(int), setWeight(int, float) and much more.

If the specified model is not a sub-model on this hub, this method return -1

Parameters:
model - Sub-model for which we want it's index
Returns:
Sub-model's index or -1 if the specified model is not a sub-model on this hub.

getFragment

public BoundedRangeModel getFragment(int index)
Get a sub-model by it's index inside this hub.

Parameters:
index - Index of the requested sub-model
Returns:
Requested sub-model
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bound.

getWeight

public float getWeight(int index)
Get the current weight of a sub-model specified by it's index.

A sub-model has a weight that describe how much this fragment take part on the master model.
Two sub-models with the same weight represent the same range progression inside the master model.
A sub-model which has a double weight than another sub-model represent a double range progression inside the master model.
This weighting has no particular constraint, it juste help to compute a factor for each sub-models regarding theses weight.

Parameters:
index - Index of the requested sub-model for which this method will return it's weight.
Returns:
Weight of the specified sub-model.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bound.
See Also:
indexOf(BoundedRangeModel), setWeight(int, float)

setWeight

public void setWeight(int index,
                      float newWeight)
Define a new weight of sub-model specified by it's index.

A sub-model has a weight that describe how much this fragment take part on the master model.
Two sub-models with the same weight represent the same range progression inside the master model.
A sub-model which has a double weight than another sub-model represent a double range progression inside the master model.
This weighting must be a positive weight and just serve to compute a factor for each sub-models regarding theses weight.

Parameters:
index - Index of the requested sub-model for which this method will change it's weight.
newWeight - New weight to bound to the specified sub-model.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if weight is negative.
See Also:
indexOf(BoundedRangeModel), getWeight(int)

getTotalWeight

public float getTotalWeight()
Get the total weight of this hub.
This total is the sum of all sub-model's weight.

This total is used to determiner the range proportion of each sub-models regarding theses weights.

Returns:
Total weight of this hub.

dispose

public void dispose()
Free all resources of this hub.
This method is the same than a call to setMasterBoundedRangeModel(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel) with null.
That mean the the master model is removed by this method.

Sub-models are always present on this hub and can be reused after a new master will be set.
In fact, all registered-listeners from this hub are removed waiting for a new master-model.

Specified by:
dispose in interface org.divxdede.commons.Disposable

stateChanged

public void stateChanged(ChangeEvent e)
Internal method call when a change apply from a sub-model (or the master model).
This method must be public because it's a part from the ChangeListener interface,
But not should be called directly.

Specified by:
stateChanged in interface ChangeListener

split

public static BoundedRangeModelHub split(BoundedRangeModel toSplit,
                                         int length)
Split the specified BoundedRangeModel on sub-models which all will have the same weight (1.0f).
The specified model will become the master model of the resulted BoundedRangeModelHub.

Parameters:
toSplit - BoundedRangeModel to split.
length - Number of sub-models to create. Each sub-models will have the same weight.
Returns:
Hub resulting of this split operation.

split

public static BoundedRangeModelHub split(BoundedRangeModel toSplit,
                                         Number... weights)
Split the specified BoundedRangeModel on multiple sub-models.

This method take an array of weight to distribute on sub-models.
The split operation will result in a sub-model's count equally to the length of the weight's array.

Parameters:
toSplit - BoundedRangeModel to split.
weights - Weight's array giving the number of sub-models to create and theses weights to use.
Returns:
Hub resulting of this split operation.

split

public static BoundedRangeModelHub split(BoundedRangeModel toSplit,
                                         float... weights)
Split the specified BoundedRangeModel on multiple sub-models.

This method take an array of weight to distribute on sub-models.
The split operation will result in a sub-model's count equally to the length of the weight's array.

Parameters:
toSplit - BoundedRangeModel to split.
weights - Weight's array giving the number of sub-models to create and theses weights to use.
Returns:
Hub resulting of this split operation.
